New Records: Nedim Bajrami set a new record for the fastest goal scored in European Championship history with a 23-second goal against Italy.
Key Match Events: Albania opened the scoring early with Qazim Laci nodding in a superb cross from Jasir Asani in the 11th minute.
Croatia struggled to maintain possession and had less control in the game despite having more possession statistics.
Albania's Kristjan Asllani was the heartbeat of his side, providing composure in possession and energy when needed.
Croatia made several second-half changes to swing momentum in their favor, including introducing Ante Budimir to give them a better target for crosses.
Pre-Game Insights: Croatia's manager Luka Modric warned about the difficulty of the tournament, considering the group's tough opponents.
Albania, ranked 66th in the world, were seen as the fun variable in the group but had shown early signs of competitiveness.
Post-Match Reflections: Sylvinho, Albania's manager, emphasized the importance of hard work and determination in their post-match assessment.
Albania's players and fans were praised for their relentless effort, even in the face of challenges.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was described as an unexpected and entertaining romp with high-energy performances from both sides.
